text: Oedipina maritima (commonly known as the maritime worm salamander) is a species of worm salamander that lives on the island of Escudo de Veraguas. It has no natural predators, as only a few animals live on the island, but it is endangered due to deforestation. == Population == There are only eight known adult specimens and two clutches of eggs. == Threats == The only threat to the salamander is deforestation. ==References== Category:Salamanders Category:Animals of North America
title: Oedipina maritima
